response.answer_text: According to Wikipedia “Google Fi, formerly Project Fi, is an MVNO telecommunications service by Google that provides telephone calls, SMS, and mobile broadband using cellular networks and Wi-Fi. Google Fi uses networks operated by Sprint, T-Mobile, and U.S. Cellular. Google Fi is a service for US residents only, as of late 2019.” So, at this time, no. Google is a mongrel patchwork of technologies that approximate or ‘virtualize’ a network. T-Mobile’s 5G network doesn't provide 5G to Google Fi, and the available phones supporting Google Fi use LTE bands 2 and 4 plus WiFi - not 5G.
Does Google Fi support 5G? This is from Google Fi F.A.Qs help page. “Currently, unlocked phones that work with Fi and are compatible with T-Mobile’s 5G network will have access to 5G on Fi.”
